website_summaries.verdict: The overall best wheel chock choice to buy when you need to hold different types of vehicles with the same set.
pros: Comes with a large maximum weight capacity of 12,000 lbs
This is large enough to hold the weight of a truck or SUV in addition to smaller cars
The gentle 17-degree incline makes it easy to use on low-clearance vehicles as well
cons: Ramp bulges under the weight of heavier vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first time using it
customer_reviews.text: Used it one time...it broke in two 0 stars...and the first time i used it is after 30 days of purchase...cant refund..$40 down the drain
customer_reviews.author: Gary P

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful - it buckled and collapsed with a light vehicle.Glad I wasn't under it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Feb 2016. Used twice - once in Feb to change oil on a Honda Crosstour, and today June 30th 2017, to change oil on a "Nissan Altima" It literally cracked at the bottom edge and collapsed (the whole side of the ramp buckled). I pulled my car right off, as it freaked me out. Should of snapped the pic with this thing crumbled under the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Szalkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: May Not work for some vehicles on slick garage floors....
customer_reviews.text: I have a rear wheel drive mustang and at least on a garage floor the ramps kept sliding forward away from the car after going a few inches up the ramp. The ramp has a little rubber grip that when pushed down works as a grip on the ground, but once the tire moved passed it, the ramp slid away. I thought the car fell off it, scary feeling. As for quality, it seemed OK. Front wheel drive should work well. Seemed sturdy, and had no issues returning the items.
customer_reviews.author: criteriah

customer_reviews.title: Received package on June 11, 2018, return closed ...
customer_reviews.text: Received package on June 11, 2018, return closed 7/11/18. Didn't use until 7/21/18. Noticed, as I was under Camry, that there was a crack in one ramp. Scared me to think this thing might collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RAMPS UNSAFE
customer_reviews.text: These ramps may be safe for an ATV but do not use them for a vehicle. I would rate them at #3000 lb capacity. They should be recalled by manufacturer before someone gets killed
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need a car/truck ramps as strong as steel ones at a great price? Here you go!
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews that some users said the ramps cracked when used. I changed my oil on my 2011 Chevy Silverado. Heavy truck with a full tank (26 Gallons) of gas. The truck pulled right up. No slippage and I had an appointment so I had to leave the truck on the ramps for over 3 hours. After the oil change - which was awesome because I didn't need my floor jack, jack supports, etc. Backed the truck off the ramps and thought to myself - wished I had these 30 years ago! Also, the ramps are not heavy and store perfectly one on top of the other. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: timu329

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe junk.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. I bought these thinking the bad reviews were just a bunch of people who were using them wrong and I would do it right so they're not that bad. Big mistake. IThe second time I used them one of them slid on my garage floor while I was driving up on it and busted to pieces, the other one cracked after the first one failed. I followed the instructions carefully and did my best to do it right. I suppose you probably could have good luck with them if all the stars aligned for you, but you'd be better off with a jack and some jack stands.
customer_reviews.author: MNMike

customer_reviews.title: Almost crushed me
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I hardly ever write reviews. However I feel that for the safety of the community this is going to be very important. I have a 2008 Mazda 5, hardly meeting the limit of the weight of what this says it can handle. It buckled and collapsed on one side while putting the car above it. I can't imagine how badly this could've gone if I was under the car and then this crushed. As soon as the car came off, the area that folded came back to it's shape - it's not sturdy and this is a hazard. Please refund me the full amount
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Extra safety and piece of mind  for underbody work
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good height. I actually jack the car up, then let it down on the ramps. I'm changing our my shifter and linkage assembly , and The Rhino ramps give me an extra piece of mind and more safety in addition to my horses.
customer_reviews.author: SKEEZIX

customer_reviews.title: Easy 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them!!! I see some people had issues with them cracking. I have driven my fusion up on them at least 10 times and they show no signs of cracking or warping or anything. These are soooooooo much better then Jack stands. Heck even if they did break at some point I would still say i got my money's worth (assuming I'm not crushed by the car when and if they do)
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great Ramps. You’re going to love them.
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. Be safe though, get a couple of jackstands under the car on the frame once the car is on these as a safety plan B. Don’t be foolish. These ramps are plastic after all. The great thing was that I was able to change the oil in my BMW in less than 15 minutes. They start up low and can fit easily under low front bumpers, but an extra inch of height would’ve made these perfect for engine work other than just changing the oil. Awesome though....I’m stoked about these ramps. You’re going to love them.
customer_reviews.author: Xesez

customer_reviews.title: Work perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue how u are crackin these i did my acura cl 3k lbs nonissue. Then my 2010 taurus sho 4300lbs! It heavy no issues what so ever. I would reccomend aligning these perfectly before driving on u definitely dont want a tire over an edge that will put too much weight on one side. It needs to spread the load... so far they are awesome make sure u by rear wheel stops for $7 for saftey, plus always use parkbrake. These things make oil changes soo much faster and give u very good clearance to get under. love them.
customer_reviews.author: Pitty

customer_reviews.title: Decent bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Always jacking up cars to do pm's when I only need a little more clearance. It's a no brainer, get some cheap car ramps. Had a set of steel ones from my grandfather years ago but never liked them. So I figured I give these a try. There is a rubber block on the bottom of ramp that is supposed to prevent them from skidding out when you drive up. But since I have an epoxy coated floor with color chips these tend to slid out from some of the cars , " not all thou". So I just put a rubber mat under ramps to prevent this from happening. These will work until I can get my lifts
customer_reviews.author: j accardi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, used on 2018 WRX
customer_reviews.text: Reading all the bad reviews of these lifts, I had to write something. These have worked very well fir me, and this is my second set. If you use common sense, and line your tires correctly, they work as expected. I check them before and after use and have never had any issues. These are great for general purpose work, oil changes etc. I even used mine while installing a hitch frame and was very comfortable working under the vehicle. The key is getting your tires aligned and evenly distributed on the lifts. Wrx tires are wide, and fit with about 1 inch on both sides when on the lift. Common sense people.
customer_reviews.author: [name not found]

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Not a confidence inspiring design or construction. I have used two different sets of metal and grey plastic ramps from a local big box store and auto parts store. Both of those are better made and less expensive. These ramps have several stress points that should have been a red flag to any engineer designing them. I can definitely see how they WILL break as many other reviewers showed. The plastic is thin and not of high quality. Definitely not Rhino tough as the manufacturer would like you to believe. I’m returning these and buying another grey plastic set locally.
customer_reviews.author: Burt Cousinski

customer_reviews.title: First Use Damaged Ramps.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1996 extended cab short bed Chevy C1500. It's not a huge or super heavy truck. I set up the ramps so they'd be centered with the tires. I made sure to slowly and carefully drive up the ramps. They ended up sliding on the concrete floor of my shop. The ramp holding the front right tire held up just fine. However, the one holding the front left tire was noticeably bending under the weight. They did the job, but I'm worried about the longevity of the products. Definitely doesn't seem like they'd hold up over many uses. This is unacceptable considering that If these ramps fail, the falling vehicle could seriously injure or kill someone.
customer_reviews.author: Alex McNiel

customer_reviews.title: Steep angle, won’t work for sports cars. Missing parts on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t get a chance to use this product because they arrived missing the rubber grips that go on the bottom and keep them from sliding as you pull your car forward. They may have held up fine, but I don’t know as they’re unusable without the rubber footings. I know this because I attempted to use them with my wife’s Mazda CX-5. The ramp angle was too steep for my Porsche Boxster 987. The car isn’t that low to the ground, but it is too low for these ramps. I had to pony-up the extra cash to buy racing ramps.
customer_reviews.author: ZF

customer_reviews.title: A bit misleading on weight capacity
customer_reviews.text: Nice ramps, and have good design features. However each ramp is rated at 3000 lbs, so a total of 6000 lbs, front or rear. So 12000 lbs isn't ramp capacity, yes, I know you can explain this from different perspectives, but good to read the fine print.
customer_reviews.author: holson

customer_reviews.title: DONT LISTEN TO MOST OF THESE NEGATIVE REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to test these ramps but will update when I do however the issue I have with these negative reviews is the fact that 90% of the reviews saying how easily they break and how bad they are and dangerous do not properly use this product! Most of these reviews use the product on gravel, dirt, and slick surfaces when the instructions clearly state to use them on a hard flat non slick surface able to withstand the pressure! So my suggestion before trying these out is to read the instructions on the side of the ramps could save you money, frustration , and most importantly your life
customer_reviews.author: Luis Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: About as stable as changing oil on ice.
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever... I bought these to replace a set of ramps purchased around 20 years ago since these are nesting. Problem is that the contact points with the garage floor are limited and slick as ice. They have one tokin piece of rubber at the tip of thr ramp which immediately disengage once the tire passes over it and the ramps simply slide. Had to purchase non slip mat to place under the ramps to keep them from sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I Should Have Purchased Steel Ramps
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these ramps to help level my small class C motor home in my drive way. Before you get excited, the front axle weight of my motor home is 4,400 lbs. These ramps are rated at 12,000 lb. GVW. The ramps distorted under the weight and I did not feel that they were safe to use. Since I used them, I can't return them -- now I have to cut the stupid things up so that I can get them into my recycle bin. Adios $40.
customer_reviews.author: Oley

customer_reviews.title: These ramps work well.
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are an excellent product for the money. They work great. Even the low bumper of my little sub-compact car clear the front of the ramps, which isn't the case with many other ramps (especially metal ones). The gradual ramp elevation allows for this. One recommendation... if you using these on gravel and dirt, throw a thin 1/4" piece of plywood under each one to protect them from rocks. I put a small crack in one because of a small rock... no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: dan santelli

customer_reviews.title: Don't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: My brother warned me about the potential problem with these ramps but I bought them anyway. I should have listened. No way to keep them in place on the garage floor so they slide forward with the car. I might see if I can find a way to put a board behind them that blocks against the wall so they can't move forward but that would be a pain. Basically now all I can do is jack the car up and then put the car down on the ramps (but I had jackstands for that already).
customer_reviews.author: Product L.

customer_reviews.title: Not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Loved these until I let my son assist me with getting the car on them. He drove over them and I then spent the next 20 minutes jacking up the car on each side to get them out from underneath the vehicle as they were stuck. They both cracked, one slightly and the other almost completely.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I expected
customer_reviews.text: These had great reviews, and I trusted the brand but the first time I tried to use them one of the ramps broke and ended up under the vehicle. It did not last one use. Will be contacting the seller or manufacturer. I will update with their thoughts and resolution. In the meanwhile I would not reccomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Santana

customer_reviews.title: About as meh as it gets
customer_reviews.text: A bit sketchy. Hard to believe that harbor freight has a more reliable product. I've used these 3 times. 2 times I drove the car on the ramps. 1 time I had my wife do it so I could watch. My Subaru legacy seemed to put a good deal if stress on them. Pros: very light. Stacks nicely. Cons: small cars make them look like they could buckle. Only one rubber foot to assist in sliding.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: PSA: DO NOT BUY IF YOU VALUE YOUR LIFE
customer_reviews.text: If you value your vehicle and your life DO NOT BUY THESE... my stepdad and I were getting ready to work on the underneath of my truck when we heard cracking we scrambled back to our feet, When both of these ramps catastrophically failed.. the one broken and half got lodged between my wheel well and chipped a whole bunch of paint off... this is hands down the worst investment I have ever made... not only they these ramps almost get us both killed because they did not meet the weight requirements as described... they also chipped off a good bit of paint off my new truck....
customer_reviews.author: Bryan E.

customer_reviews.title: These work well, and are a good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I never had drive-up ramps like this before, and I must admit I was a little wary of driving my car up onto them (sure, don't overshoot and "fall" over the cliff). My 2014 Toyota Prius C Level One is too low to the ground for these (bottom front lip of car hits the ramp before the tires meet it), but that obstacle was easily solved by laying down some 2" x 8" boards just ahead of each ramp -- to create a sort of elevating runway to them. These feel sturdy and do the job. All the same, I place jack stands under my car, too, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Geewhizicist

customer_reviews.title: Only 2 small feet of each ramp contact the ground. Seems risky.
customer_reviews.text: I sent these back. As other reviewers have noted, there are only two small contact points on each ramp that rest on the ground. There is a little rubber foot on the front and on the back of each block that makes contact with the ground. I was not comfortable resting all of that weight on two little feet. Plus, the plastic is a little less sturdy feeling than i had hoped. It’s not flimsy, it’s just not sturdy enough to earn my confidence.
customer_reviews.author: btt118

customer_reviews.title: worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: so I bought to do oil change after a Honda dealer told me it would be 500 to cut a oil pan out from under my car which I found out afterwords it was only because they stripped a screw that held my oil pan up and they couldnt get it out, anyway I figured I'd get this and check for myself and within a few mins I was under my car...got my oil change done and now I'm up 450 and a pair of ramps.
customer_reviews.author: lash

customer_reviews.title: 3 TIMES RAMP SLIPPED ON ME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very dangerous and not designed properly as there is only 1 rubber grip to hold in place but as soon as I get half way up the ramp, it slides out due to no grip on back end
customer_reviews.author: echo

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have gotten ramps ages ago
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted ramps to use when changing oil and working under the car for ages. It's always been something I put off for whatever reason though, and finally decided to get some. I'm really wishing I wouldn't have waited. I've already used these half a dozen times to change oil, inspect the underside of the car, and try to track down a pesky rattle. They are so light, yet so tough, and so easy to use. I can't believe I waited.
customer_reviews.author: F. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Good for the DIY mechanic
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned due to some of the reviews about how sturdy these were but when I saw some mobile mechanics use these on various vehicles, I decided to order them. I used them for the first time changing the motor oil of my Prius. As a result, I’m very happy with them and would recommend them if you’re a DIY mechanic. They are quite sturdy but make sure your tires are squarely in the middle of these ramps. I would recommend them to everyone for cars and smaller trucks and suv’s.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Awesome Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great ramps for doing oil changes etc on your car or crossover! Quality construction and really lightweight and easy to move and set up! It has really well-made rubber pads on the bottom to keep ramps from slipping which is a nice feature. Usually, the cheaper ones don't have them at all or they snap off by the second time you use them! Ramps have a nice height so it gives you plenty of space to work under your car or cars engine! If you do your own oil changes and maintenance on your car this is a must-have for your garage!
customer_reviews.author: Runway

customer_reviews.title: Package Dimensions =/= Ramp Size
customer_reviews.text: They seem sturdy and didn't skid at all on the concrete, however: There was no mention of actual RAMP dimensions that I could find, but I erroneously assumed that the package dimensions would give me a general idea. I was VERY wrong. The ramp height for these is only 7" at the edge, and about 6.5" where your wheels rest. Actual ramp dimensions: 12" Wide, 36" long, 7" Tall. Nowhere close to the 17" I was expecting/hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good product, a little tricky to use.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, fairly sturdy, raise the vehicle enough to work under it. The only issues from using these ramps is that they tend to skip under the traction of the tires, so if you are trying to get your vehicle up the ramps, one may go up but the ramp on the other side slips out. They seem to work best if you back up onto them rather than driving forward up the ramp. I'm using these to raise a Rzr XP 4 1000 for oil changes.
customer_reviews.author: 31NDUN

customer_reviews.title: Works well + sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, was not damaged or anything. Was a little nervous using them at first but my car is well below the max weight they support. The bottom corners where the car drive up looks smushed now but its expected, Make sure they're centered under the wheels before using, be careful driving up the ramp too much gas might make car go over the little stops at the top. but you feel the car hit them and jus let off the gas asap. If a novice like me can use them anyone can but use parking break! Overall pleased I purchased and lets me change oil and filter with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and seems to take the heat
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 of these plus 2 steel to get a Subaru higher off the ground to work underneath. The Subie climbs them w/o smoking the clutch, but adding a foot or so length of 2x6 to obtain a shallower angle makes it easier. Ramp stop once on top is adequate to prevent driving off the other side. These have been supporting the Subaru for a couple of weeks in Arizona heat in excess of 100 deg F with no sign of buckling, but then that's only about 1000lb in each corner. While working underneath, though had a gopher snake peeking out the front opening. .
customer_reviews.author: remote camper

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love how they're light enough that I don't feel like I'm lugging them around my driveway, but they feel sturdy when you hold them and you can tell how strong they are when you put your car on them. I also really like how since they're plastic if I'm driving the car forward and someone is guiding me it's easy for them to slide it over and it not scratch my pavement like metal ones would.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Tough Ramps - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Supports my car no problem. No shifting or moving when driving up, and no bending or straining that I can see. I was able to confidently get under my car and work without worrying about the car coming down on me. This goes without saying that if you do use them, as with any ramp, put on your emergency parking brake! Honestly I was worried because of the low price, but these are well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Biggs

customer_reviews.title: What a great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I grew tired of paying to have someone do my oil change for me. I purchased these so I could do themselves. They are pretty sturdy and for under $40, a great purchase. There is a little gripper that appears to drop down as you roll your car up that helps prevent the ramps from moving around as you drive your vehicle up on them. -The only thing I would want is that they were about 4 inches taller. That would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews=Yelp like,

customer_reviews.title: I'm not saying dont buy them,but love yourself a bit more!!
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost I always take good and bad reviews to heart and make a judgment call from there. These ramps are a very reasonable price and lightweight. But to be honest that's all they got going for them. I got these delivered at the end of may and it is the beginning of September right now, I have used them only 2 times, and yes kept them out of extreme heat (living in AZ). One ramp is already cracking down the bottom corner of where the tire sits and has all its weight. Unless your ready to die like the Notorious B.I.G. album,DONT BUY THESE. SPEND MORE ON THE OLD SCHOOL METAL ONES!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used with Subaru Impreza Hatchback, no issues what so ever. Had some concerns based on some of the reviews, but the 1 use so far was great, was able to drive up and leave on the ramps for an oil change. Feel a bit safer purchasing these heavier duty ones. That said, was still cautious with putting stands under car for safety. I would recommend! Makes for a simpler oil change experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Other uses for ramps (besides auto)
customer_reviews.text: I got these ramps (really only needed one) to help me mount my heavy ebike onto my bike rack. With this ramp, I can load, my bike myself without needing any help. I'm sure that these ramps would work perfectly for their intended use. For my use with the bike, I wish they expanded/contracted like an accordian for easier transport (they take up half my back seat and truck is full of camping gear).
customer_reviews.author: SeaAnita

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as steel at all
customer_reviews.text: This is no where near as strong as steel like it claims. Its plastic. It'll get the job done, but be incredibly cautious using this things. They didnt slide while I was going up, but if your tire touches the end nub they grind against the ground hard. They safest way to go up these is to literally poition them against your tire as straight as possible. Then SLOWLY creep up them, you do NOT want to over do it and end up damaging your vehicle. They're not all bad though, once your vehicle is up, its pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Slides out on concrete garage floor
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to do, but slides out way to easily when trying to drive up them. I ended up having to rig something up to keep them from shooting out every time I tried to drive up them slowly (my car is an E92 M3). Once parked in the groove they held up and I didn’t get flattened while changing my oil. So I guess that’s win!
customer_reviews.author: S. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but garbage to say the least
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these so badly. Unfortunately they turned out to be a total flop. They have no Traction of grip. Instead of driving up onto the ramps, my car just pushes them. In a very unsafe manner at that. Just remember to save the box, your going to need it for the return.
customer_reviews.author: BigNickDigger

customer_reviews.title: Have held up to the test of time for me
customer_reviews.text: These have held up well for me. I do all of my vehicles oil changes etc. using these ramps & one of them is an 2005 Avalanche .... it's pretty heavy to say the least & the ramps don't even flex, make funny unnerving sounds or distort in any way ... so I feel comfortably safe when using them with wheel chocks.
customer_reviews.author: 4strokes

customer_reviews.title: Good Ramps.
customer_reviews.text: Got these today and drove my Honda Civic up on them to do a small job and these seem sturdy. Of course my cars weighs only 2300 pounds so probably 1/4-1/3 of that weight are on the ramps. I like them so far. Easy to drive up on. If you don't have a spotter or guide person then I suggest butting up the ramps against your front tires, make sure they're straight and center with your tires, then pull up on them slowly until you feel it dip down at the top and then stop. It's easy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son used these to do work on his vehicle and the corner broke and the car almost fell on my 19 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Howse

customer_reviews.title: Scary.
customer_reviews.text: At first glance these ramps looked awesome. I used them to get underneath my 2006 Roush Mustang. When I bought them, I did not read any reviews until now. I used these a second time and noticed the side wall started to buckle. I quickly got out from underneath the car. I now put in jack stands whenever these are used. Be careful out there people.
customer_reviews.author: SrMac

customer_reviews.title: A whole lot better than jacks and stands.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Rather scary the first few times you use them. Even though I don’t have anything that heavy, it may have been a better purchase to get the higher weight rated version. I’m pretty sure the stronger version is a bit wider. They’re rather difficult to line up straight with your wheels and I have gotten up with a tire hanging over the edge a bit. A wider ramp would be a bit better to help with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey key

customer_reviews.title: BUCKLED UNDER WEIGHT of 2013 Tahoe. Ramps slide on dry garage floor.  DIFFICULT to get vehicles on.
customer_reviews.text: Like: price and stackable easy storage. Dislike: After only four uses, passenger side ramp buckled while I was under my 2013 Tahoe. (See pic) not sure why because it's way under advertised 12k weight limit. but now have useless ramps. Another dislike is that the ramps slide on the dry concrete garage floor making it more than difficult to get vehicles on the ramps. Twice it took two other grown men to brace the ramps from sliding while trying to go onto the ramps.
customer_reviews.author: MSGT RoyL

customer_reviews.title: They Work
customer_reviews.text: I used these the other day to change the oil on my 2019 Impala. The tires are somewhat large and it took me a couple of tries before I got it right. They supported the car just fine and I was really comfortable being underneath the vehicle. They store nicely as they fit together and take up less space then I thought they would. They are inexpensive too, I have no complaints and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: greystoke62

customer_reviews.title: Well built units
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair of these for a long time now, use them outside our 12x20 shed to get rider in and out but now have a scooter too so had to buy another set so we can park them side by side without having to move the ramps. before the scooter was behind mower and had to be taken out first and mower way inside, now both right at overhead door and more work area at back of shed
customer_reviews.author: Smiley1956

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: I used this ramp to pick up the 2 front tires on a 3wheel CanAm Spyder. It did the job after 5 attempts to keep them from sliding forward. I tried it on 3 different concrete surfaces. Finally I placed the ramps on a rubber excersise mat. It took 2 attempts but worked. Maybe this problem was associated with the relativity light weight of a motorcycle. In any event knowing all this I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R

customer_reviews.title: They do what they are supposed to
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice light weight and durable ramps. They are not steel so they don't rust. I bought them for doing oil changes on my side by side, but they are perfect for washing the under belly of my 4 wheeler after going out in the mud all weekend. They will get a great deal of use. I strongly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Gee man

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 suburban and I was very skeptical about these ramps to hold my truck for so long. I used them more than 5 times already and they still hold up like if they were constructed of steel. I am still amazed at how well built they are. I know most people write a simple short review but I am an everyday handy mechanic who is always wanting to help out other people with things. I must say that these are worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Espy

customer_reviews.title: Lasts under a constant load!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my ramps for a while now. They have held up numerous vehicles of different weights. Most impressed by how sturdy they are! I have had a car that doesn't run sitting on them for the past 6 months now. They have supported the vehicle with no complications in the slightest! I highly recommend them as a reliable form of propping your vehicle up. A million times safer than Harbor Freight jack stands!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle w.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, work for lower clearance cars
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy ramps and are long / low enough to work on my stock 2003 VW Jetta with sport suspension (lower clearance than many other base model sedans). The raised “stop bump” at the top is also great for having a guide to know when you’ve reached the end of the ramp. Otherwise you may not make it to work! Haha. I recommend these and expect them to last for life.
customer_reviews.author: Taco machine

customer_reviews.title: They Slide!
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to receive this, so I could change the oil in my G387, but when I came home and attempted to use them, all they did was shoot out from under the car. No matter how I placed them, I would make it up about 6 inches and BAM, the car would drop down and I could see the ramps in front of me. Very disappointed, will have to keep looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: mitchell dinep

customer_reviews.title: tough ramps
customer_reviews.text: my challenger is kinda close to the ground, these ramps make changing my oil so much easier. They have a gradual slope for low cars and enough height to still get your car up high enough the work on, they are pretty light, considering what they do and how strong they are plus they stack together for storage....takes up less space in my shop. Good product maybe even great when you figure in the price.
customer_reviews.author: TNKEN

customer_reviews.title: Portable, Easy to Use, and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: These worked out great for oil changes on 3 vehicles(Mini Cooper Clubman, Chevy Colorado, Chrysler Town and County). I read reviews on them breaking for some people, but I haven't experienced any issues yet. My advise is to go slow and easy and be prepared to brake. Also, make sure they are lined up properly. They provided plenty of room under the vehicles and I was able to throw them in my back seat and change my friends’ oil at remote locations very quickly. A worthy investment.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me Down Here

customer_reviews.title: Great Ramps!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had purchased a set of these before now! These make changing my oil a breeze! Before getting these I had to bring out the jack and jack stands and it never failed, either the jack or the jack stands would be in my way. Now I can simply place these in front of my tires and drive forward up on them and I don't have to deal with jack or jack stands being in my way.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Light Vehicle Ramps
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and light vehicle ramps that stack for easy storage. I have used these multiple times with a 2013 Honda Accord to change my oil. These have some rubber foot feature that prevents slippage on smooth or dusty concrete. I was able to ramp my car up solo and perform the oil change. I intend to use these when I eventually change the oil on my new 4Runner. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Solid ramps!
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are fantastic for DIY car/truck work. Amazing how easy it is to roll up on them by yourself; they don't shift at all with the rubber stops and multiple points of contact on the bottom. And I have no fear of working under my truck now. My Dad had very old metal ramps that shifted when we tried to drive up on them, were slim, and they were pretty rickety. These Rhinogear ramps are stable, wide, and solid throughout. Working on our vehicles has been much less stressful now.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Scalo

customer_reviews.title: Good product worth the money can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, I’ve had several of these throughout the years from different manufacturers and this one certainly looks and feels to be a high-quality product, it will work for you, just remember the final directions say 3000 pounds each a total of 6000 pounds and that is more than satisfactory for any car our truck because you’re only lifting the front of it anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Drifter 218   BRFFBR!

customer_reviews.title: $36.27 deal
customer_reviews.text: This set is great for small profile cars without a lot of ground clearance. I don't know if these will actually hold 12k gross weight, and do not intend to find out, but worked as intended for an oil change. Of course, always use chocks, emergency brakes and appropriate vehicle stands when under your vehicle. One hidden flaw could ruin your entire day.
customer_reviews.author: MC Ronson

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my Subaru WRX
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for my 2017 Subaru WRX. I was worried that the front end of the WRX would be too low to use the ramps, but I was able to drive right up the ramps without any scraping or anything. Very nice and way easier than jacking the car up and using car jacks. Would definitely recommend for 2015-2017 WRX owners, which is all I can speak to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ramps.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these for working on my Dodge RAM 4x4, and they perform well. They hold up the front end of the truck with no problems, and are long enough that you don't need to worry about rolling off the end of the ramps. Also easy storage as they stack one on top of the other, and stand on end, using minimal space.
customer_reviews.author: Bill J

customer_reviews.title: These may be defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair at Home Depot about 3 years ago but went through a divorce and lost them. So I bought these to do my own oil changes again. I drove up on them and heard a noise that didn’t sound right. I got out of the vehicle and saw the front of the driver side broke off. The first pair I purchased from Home Depot I used over and over to do work on my Veloster that I had with no issues. These may have had a defect in them but if I was under the vehicle I may have been killed.
customer_reviews.author: magerm77

customer_reviews.title: Two Oil Changes In, So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of these ramps when I read some of the one star reviews, but I haven't had any issues as of yet. Changed oil on an '03 Ford Taurus SES and an '01 Subaru Outback, so the ramps are rated higher than I need. Recommend for basic vehicle maintenance. I would also recommend having someone watch the ramps while someone drives the vehicle on to them because it'd be easy to make a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.

customer_reviews.title: So Nice
customer_reviews.text: So these ramps are amazing! I just finished changing my oil, which I never had ramps before. Using these was a breeze. I did everything myself and felt confident the whole time. The ramps are extremely sturdy, and stay in place securely with their rubbery bottom pieces. I'm very happy with these and expect them to last a long time for many more car services.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Poor Dangerous Design
customer_reviews.text: After looking at how these are made there is no way I would feel safe running my 2009 Honda Accord up on these ramps !!! I see a lot of flaws in the design where they could crack and break. I'm not one for return stuff so I will just throw them back in the barn!!! I might run my lawn mower up on them that might be safe to do.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I got these ramps and used them to do some work on my Honda Odyssey. They lifted the vehicle high enough that I could comfortable get under the vehicle, were more than strong enough, and were wide enough for the tires. Those were the main issues I was looking for these ramps to address and they ticked all of the boxes. On top of that, they were a great price. After looking at tons of reviews on various sites, I am glad I went with this set of ramps!
customer_reviews.author: Florappaloosier

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: They have been very sturdy and useful, but ill be switching to something stronger now that one of them cracked a bit under the pressure of my moms camry.
customer_reviews.author: Kal Z.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used ramps for oil changes for years, I have always had steel ramps. and they are HEAVY!! These sure make oil changes much easier, no more dragging the heavy steel ramps out. I will say, I am not sure I would want to place a heavy vehicle on these, but these work perfectly for my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good buy but need some technique
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely easier to use then jacks if you use them correctly. However, it will take you some time to find the right time to stop the car while climbing this tool. Twice my car go over the end of this and end up crushing them underneath the car. Have to use the jacks to jack up the car and get them out. I guess it takes some practice.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't keep still on flat surface
customer_reviews.text: I got this in Amazon package... When I opened and moved the two apart, three small round things from bottom broke its own... And the inside one was not keeping still and was moving on a flat floor... I took it outside nd put my car on it... The one which was moving moved a lil but as far was heavy it didn't move the whole.. I think so the small rounds which broke in my un packaging made it jiggle.
customer_reviews.author: Asim

customer_reviews.title: Have someone guide you up!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be honest, I’m still not completely comfortable using these. But so far no major issues. I did have one slip under the car but that was because I pulled up too far. Please have someone guide you up and make sure you’re aligned. If my car was lower I was have jacked up my side skirt. I only gave three stars because I feel these won’t hold up long. The sides are Buckling in a little on one. When in doubt use jack stands though.
customer_reviews.author: cisco mincey

customer_reviews.title: Giving away
customer_reviews.text: These ramps failed... As my car rolled up, the ramps kept sliding and giving the car a little gas to grip the little grippers on the bottom didn't help. My car ended up rolling slightly over the damn ramps and I had to end up spending 30mins using Jack's anyway to lift my car and remove the ramps under my car...
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my new SUV has a low profile front end which meant I could not get under it to do regular maintenance. The angle of the ramps are so that there is plenty of clearance to pull the vehicle on to them. They are light enough to move around easy but sturdy enough to easily support my full size SUV and they stack together for compact storage. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rlind1968

customer_reviews.title: Do highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Are great-bought to pull truck on them (all 4 Wheels). Put truck in 4-wheel drive-ramps tend to slide some. Will have to get rubber mates to set them on maybe help to not skid. I think if pulling up on only 2 no problem. However they were awesome for pulling my motorcycle trike up on to change oil and grease. Will use in grass when pulling truck on them-maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy BILLIPS

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk! Stay away for your own safety. Started to crack after 3rd use, by the 4th a small piece of plastic broke off, after the 5th use a large piece broke off and is no longer safe to use. Can't get any warranty support. Complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Braheem

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: So I wish they had a rubber grip on the bottom I tried to go slow and had my car in eco mode so it wouldn't give to much power shot it out and damaged part of my car but luckily you can't tell unless you know where to look but I did fix it lots of hot water and pushing the dent out can't tell anymore but get rubber grips on the bottom
customer_reviews.author: 3 percenter

customer_reviews.title: Good set of ramps, surprised by bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: Have used countless times on the front end of my 2500hd Duramax diesel. Set them up properly on a level surface , push ramps into both tires so your first move forward is already touching/proceeding up ramp. Try to avoid stopping too suddenly. Do a walk around to check for any extreme flexing before getting underneath. Never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my car (2011 Toyota Camry)
customer_reviews.text: We finally went to use them and my car can’t get up them because the incline is too steep... my car is low but not that low. We haven’t lowered it and the body kit on it is stock. Not sure how it will be on another vehicle. Wish we would have tried to use um when we first got them so we could have returned them 🤦‍♀️.... now it’s been a few month 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Celedonio Cortez III

customer_reviews.title: Not safe to use
customer_reviews.text: First time I use it, it broke. I use it with a MB Sprinter3500, about 11,000 lbs. I should have order the 16,000lbs unit.....I would never crawl under with such weak, unsafe design. Now I need to find a way to be reimburse but it looks to be difficult. When you buy via Amazon you might get a good price but as far as warranty support, forget it. Next time I will buy from Walmart or Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are really nice. They’re lightweight and portable. Currently being used for maintenance on lawn tractors. Also for those having trouble pulling them apart and separating them I found a simple solution. Drop them from about 1 foot to a carpeted area on the large ends of the ramps and they separated easily.
customer_reviews.author: justjack

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I am taking the time to write this because I did not expect them to work on all my vehicles. Lastly, I tried it on my 3500 Dodge Ram and they did not give any. Of course, I am not stupid so I also used lift supports as well. But to just drive up and go to work is nice! Never thought something plastic/rubber could hold that much weight.
customer_reviews.author: kent dubose

customer_reviews.title: They do the job, just be sure ur car isnt too low profile
customer_reviews.text: They work, but be mindful of your cars clearance.. one of my cars had trouble getting up the ramps and one even slipped under and got stuck against the underside of the car. But the product does work as described.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Harding

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: Saved me a lot changing my own oil. $170 for an oil change, not anymore. I had the metal ramp and that one bented. It was always heavy with sharp edges and a hassle to stack. But with this, it's a piece of cake to use. It's lightweight, easy to move around, and won't rust or bend.
customer_reviews.author: Clown Prince

customer_reviews.title: Seems sketchy
customer_reviews.text: I tested it out and just couldn't trust the product since reading the other reviews of them breaking. Also it is a pain to get the vehicle up onto the ramps. But the ramps did seem sturdy once you get the car on there. I just couldn't get past the fact that these ramps have failed for other customers.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Could not work on my Honda Accord
customer_reviews.text: Tried lifting this on my Honda Accord and the plastic buckled after an hour on it. I suggest everyone who orders this to also put Jacks under your car for extra safety! You can't trust items like these made out of plastic no matter how safe they say. I know friends of mine has had better luck but for me not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height to work underneath my Porsche Cayenne
customer_reviews.text: This made it really easy to raise up my 2013 Porsche Cayenne S with 295/35/21" tires. Used it today to change the oil and transfer case fluid. The height it raised the Cayenne was perfect and the width - although slightly narrower than the 295mm tires, had no problem supporting the tires and the front weight of the SUV. Would recommend to anyone with a car that has enough clearance in the front to climb up the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps
customer_reviews.text: Great ramps. Lightweight and easy to move about. Work as described. However, if you overshoot them like an idiot and the frame of the car comes crashing down on them with the full weight of the car they will crack. (Don’t ask me how I know.) But even with the cracks they are super strong because of all the structure and support built into and throughout the ramps. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Working Well So Far on my Jetta and 2500 HD
customer_reviews.text: Have used these twice so far and they have worked great. Fort time was a VW Jetta, second time (see pic) was on my 2500 HD Denali. The truck is heavy and I didn’t notice any give on the ramps. Only went partial way up them to level out the truck in an uneven driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle A

customer_reviews.title: Another gift for my Son who likes them
customer_reviews.text: This is safer then jacking the car up & having your young child let the jack down when you are still underneath the car as this son did to me many years ago, but he remembers that these to avoid the from happening to him he wanted this design. .
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dobslaw

customer_reviews.title: Good price and HD as stated in the web site.
customer_reviews.text: Did not use this set until last Saturday to change oil on my son Toyota Camry. Very impress on the light weight and sturdiness. A little skeptical so put jackstands but found out no need. Very surprise on the builtin grip that hold to the ground as soon as the wheels climbed on these ramps. Highly recommended for light DIY job.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Lam

customer_reviews.title: These things are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little sketched out on the idea of being under my car while it sat on plastic blocks. However, these have made it so much easier to work on my car. They stack together for easy storage and are relatively lightweight. Whether I'm doing oil changes, draining fluids, or replacing components, these have turned out to be a very worthwhile purchase and I highly recommend them. I've let people borrow them in the past who then in turn have gone on to buy their own because of how convenient they are.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

product_meta.title: RhinoGear 11909ABMI RhinoRamps Vehicle Ramp - Pair (12,000lb. GVW Capacity)
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingRhipGear's sturdy, durable RhinoRamps allow for reliable and convenient access to the underside of your vehicle. Patented polymer internal support system and wide stance offer excellent weight distribution and unbeatable strength. The innovative CoreTRAC non-skid base helps reduce slippage while the 17 degree incline provides easy use for low clearance vehicles. These portable automotive ramps are great for cars, pick-ups, sport utility vehicles, and vans.
feature_bullets: Portable automotive ramps with a rugged and structural design
Provides reliable and convenient access to the underside of your vehicle as well as nestability for maximum storage space
CoreTRAC non-skid base helps reduce slippage
17 degree incline provides easy use for low clearance vehicles
12,000 pound GVW (gross vehicle weight) capacity and for use with tires 9" in width

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,192 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
